current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committee discharged; considered and agreed to

text.#text:
high schools,
			 colleges, universities, administrators, teachers, primary schools, and
			 secondary schools to launch campus-wide educational campaigns to urge
			 students
			 to focus on safety when driving;

national trucking
			 firms to alert their drivers to be especially focused on driving safely on
			 the
			 Sunday after Thanksgiving, and to publicize the importance of the day
			 through
			 use of the Citizens Band Radio Service and at truck stops across the
			 United
			 States;

law enforcement
			 personnel to remind drivers and passengers to drive safely, particularly
			 on the
			 Sunday after Thanksgiving;

motorists to drive safely, not just during the holiday season, but every
			 time
			 they get behind the wheel; and

all people of the
			 United States to understand the life-saving importance of wearing a seat
			 belt and to use the Sunday after Thanksgiving as an opportunity to
			 educate
			 themselves about highway safety; and

Whereas motor vehicle travel is the primary means of
			 transportation in the United States;

Whereas every individual traveling on the roads and
			 highways needs to drive in a safer manner to reduce deaths and injuries
			 that
			 result from motor vehicle accidents;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, wearing a seat belt saves as many as 15,000 lives each
			 year; and

text.#text:
Whereas the Sunday after Thanksgiving is the busiest
			 highway traffic day of the year: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 583 ATS: Designating November 30, 2014, as “Drive Safer Sunday”.
